user_review: Great italian restaurant for quality dining. Good for families, very nice and attentive staff. Very satisfied everytime we est there.

No Clowning around.Il Pagliaccio is a cozy fine dining restaurant with chic/modern decor. Jacky juggled his 5 course meal of beet salad, eggplant parm, gnocchi & a tender cut of contre fillet de veau accompanied with an array of premium wines. Head pagliaccio, Manny, is serving fresh of the day. No frozen foods on your dish unless you get the semi-fredo for dessert. Price is no laughing matter but expected for the great/classy service & quality of food. Parking is a joke but you'll have the last laugh once you're done with this joint.Follow @JackyEatsMTL

A table facing the window watching the sun beaming in the Outremont neighbourhood was the therapy for the day. This is small cozy Italian restaurant with staff that is attentive.The menu is limited but yet covers all areas of meat, pasta and fish for your delight. Crusty Bread and bread sticks are served immediately before ordering. Sweet potato and carrot soup for appetizer. Light and tasty. My main course was filet of veal with a green peppercorn sauce served with an array of veggies. Cooked to perfection. To end the lunch I had my signature cappuccino with panne cotta (mediocre). My experience as a whole was wonderful, good food with a romantic twist.

Came here for a small business dinner at the recommendation of a colleague. Was reluctant initially but am glad I came. Food was wonderful. The highlight: a homemade tagliatelle w white truffle and egg yolk (this was a special). Fabulous!!! Also had their fish of the day which was well executed and simple. Not too heavy and sauced up. Finished the meal off w a panna cotta. Probably the low point of the meal: just ok, nothing special.Overall: may skip dessert in the future but will most definitely be back.(Remark: I give 4 stars for now since the dessert wasn't perfect and I wonder if the incredible white truffle starter is an outlier that isn't always available. If my latter worry is assuaged in a future visit, I'll probably revise to 5 stars.)

Absolutely delicious Italian food with a warm and welcoming staff who even brought a kid-friendly amuse bouche for the littlest diners at our table. House made breadsticks and bread keep the kids happy while you enjoy the more sophisticated fare.

You bet, as good as it gets!  Came here to meet descendants of the Shah who are working on, well, let's not talk about that!  Anyway, the pasta with truffles was stunning and the venison was, well, to kill for....  But that's not all.  A fine wine form Alto Adagio, some fine after dinner drinks, and it was a splendid performance on all accounts.

Really good italian food. Verry good service. Good wine. We had many appetizers like eggplant with parmesan, lobster, fried crab and many more. Fish and foie de veau are delicious and the scalops as well.
We ordered 2 pasta dishes. My partner saw nothing she wanted so they created a special dish for her. Both dishes were excellent and the service was warm and friendly.
